abstracts.cdata!:
The Sustainable Fisheries Development
            Project intended to identify innovative, and cost-effective
            mechanisms to strengthen the ocean fisheries management
            capacity of the Government, to be expanded according to the
            implementation of a Quota Management System (QMS). However,
            at approval time, it was realized that the project failed to
            be included by the Ministry of Agriculture in the multi-year
            Budget, as presented to the Ministry of Finance in mid-2001.
            After repeated requests by the Bank, the Ministry of
            Agriculture informed it had been compelled to prioritize its
            requirements within a tight CY2002 budget, thus, not
            considering the project a high priority, in addition to
            internal conflicts potentially affecting project
            implementation. Following the economic and political crises
            in the country, although the new administration expressed
            interest in the project, it was unable to assign the
            necessary budget for the project, and, on June 13, 2002 the
            Bank informed the Government of the formal withdrawal of the
            loan. This Project Completion Note stipulates the Bank
            conducted significant sector work linked to the project
            preparation, culminating in a Rural Development Working
            Paper, that provided an overview on marine fisheries,
            serving as well as an advisory document on the
            implementation of the QMS.

TF025704-PHRD-SUSTAINABLE FISHERIES
            MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF036465-ARGENTINA - ARGENTINA FISHERIES
            MANAGEMENT SECTOR REVIEW,TF036696-ARGENTINA - SUSTAINABLE

            FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PROJECT,TF037967-ARGENTINA - SUSTAINABLE
            FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Sustainable Fisheries Management
            Project, will identify innovative, cost-effective mechanisms
            for strengthening fisheries management capacity, in accord
            with the strategic context to modernize the role of the
            public sector. The components will: 1) strengthen the
            management capacity of the Secretariat of Agriculture,
            Livestock, Fisheries and Food (SAGPyA), particularly those
            functions required under the Quota Management System,
            including identification of service requirements, and cost
            effective mechanisms for service delivery. Local, and
            foreign technical assistance (TA) will be financed to review
            key functional responsibilities, and propose institutional,
            and operational modifications, including provision of
            equipment, and training needs; 2) strengthen monitoring,
            control and surveillance functions of SAGPyA, through: the
            development of license, and quota registry; improved
            fisheries inspection services; and, a pilot on-board
            observer program to address research needs. Information, and
            communication systems will be developed, supported by
            improved hardware/software infrastructure; 3) pilot social
            assistance action centers for unemployed fisheries workers,
            assessing existing labor programs, targeting vulnerable
            industry workers in coordination with cooperatives, unions,
            and industry as a whole; and, 4) provide administrative
            support for project implementation.
